revision.comment: Reformatted inc heading for comedy career and awards
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2018}} {{Use British English|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Kiri Pritchard-Mclean | image = <!-- filename only, no "File:" or "Image:" prefix, and no enclosing [[brackets]] --> | alt = <!-- descriptive text for use by speech synthesis (text-to-speech) software --> | caption = | birth_name = <!-- only use if different from name --> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|11|6|df=y}} | birth_place = Gloucester, England | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|df=yes|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (DEATH date then BIRTH date) --> | death_place = | nationality = British | other_names = | occupation = | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = }}
'''Kiri Pritchard-Mclean''' (born Kiri Mclean, 6 November 1986) is a British comedian. Born in [[Gloucester]], she was raised on a farm in [[Anglesey]], [[Wales]]. She has performed for several consecutive years at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe and won two Chortle awards.
==Comedy career==
She is the director and writer for sketch group Gein's Family Giftshop who were [[List of Edinburgh Comedy Award winners|nominated for Best Newcomer]] in 2014 for the [[Edinburgh Comedy Awards|Edinburgh Comedy Award]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/stage/2015/aug/14/edinburgh-comedy-festival-roundup-fringe-winning-geins-family-giftshop-jerrod-kinane|title=Edinburgh comedy roundup: the best of the rest â€“ week one|last=Logan|first=Brian|date=2015-08-14|work=The Guardian|access-date=2017-05-11|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> As a sketch group they were also nominated for [[Chortle (website)|Chortle Awards]] in 2015. She took her debut show ''Hysterical Woman'' to the [[Edinburgh Festival Fringe|Edinburgh Fringe Festival]] in 2016.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/stage/2017/apr/28/hysterical-woman-standup-sexism-in-comedy-kiri-pritchard-mclean|title=Hysterical Woman: the standup show addressing sexism in comedy|last=Logan|first=Brian|date=2017-04-28|work=The Guardian|access-date=2017-05-11|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> It transferred to the [[Soho Theatre]] for a run in June 2017.
Pritchard-Mclean has appeared on [[Russell Howard]]'s ''[[Stand-up Central|Stand Up Central]]'' on [[Comedy Central]] and [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]]'s ''Elevenish'' and has made multiple appearances on the [[BBC Radio 4]] shows ''[[The Now Show]]'', ''[[The News Quiz]]'' and [[Elis James|Ellis James]]' ''State Of the Nation''.
She is also co-host of the [[podcast]] ''All Killa No Filla'' along with fellow comedian Rachel Fairburn.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/marc-hershon/podcast-reviews-i-am-rapa_b_9499512.html|title=Podcast Reviews: I Am Rapaport & All Killa No Filla|last=Hershon|first=Marc|date=2016-03-18|website=Huffington Post|language=en-US|access-date=2017-05-11}}</ref>
==Comedy awards==
Pritchard-Mclean was nominated as [[Chortle Awards|Best Compere]] in 2016 & 2017. She won Best Compere and Best Club Comedian at the Chortle Awards in 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chortle.co.uk/news/2018/03/18/39430/women_dominate_the_chortle_live_comedy_awards|website=Chortle|publisher=Chortle Awards|accessdate=22 April 2018|ref=Chortle Awards 2018}}</ref>
